snippet: The new austerity measures, which include further cuts to pensions, civil service salaries and social benefits, are required to unlock $40 billion in rescue financing.
abstract: Greek government prepares to push through new round of austerity measures, totaling $23 billion in cuts over four years; measures, while required to secure $40 billion in international rescue financing, have potential to cause governmental instability as some members of coalition government break rank and public expresses displeasure.

byline.original: By LIZ ALDERMAN and RACHEL DONADIO

lead_paragraph: The new austerity measures, which include further cuts to pensions, civil service salaries and social benefits, are required to unlock $40 billion in rescue financing.

headline.seo: Greece to Vote on $23 Billion in New Cuts
headline.main: Greece Prepares to Vote on $23 Billion in New Cuts
headline.print_headline: Greece Prepares to Vote on $23 Billion in New Cuts
